page.title: 08 Farms in Lamberhurst
page.content: {Furnace Farm}house was built in about 1500 A.D. The house is built with oak beams and brick, with lathe and plaster walls. The roof is covered in{Kent Peg Tiles.}On one side of the house there is a Victorian extension. The Farm grows{hops}and has a fairly new oast house. There are still some hopper huts in which families used to live during the hopping season. The land is mainly used to grow fruit. It has many{strawberry}fields and apple and cherry{orchards}.{Sheep}also graze on the land. There are many tractors and trailers, some of which are very old.{Hoathly}is also an active farm, covering 600 acres of land. In 1984 it was bought from the Bayham Estate and now grows timber, oil seed rape, and keeps sheep. The farmer does not own any machinery but employs sub- contractors when necessary.
